The national debt is an urgent issue that needs to be addressed. Hillary Clinton has proposed increasing taxes on the wealthy, closing corporate tax loopholes, and investing in job creation to help stimulate the economy. She also supports sensible budget cuts and consolidating redundant federal programs to help reduce the deficit. With these measures, she believes that it is possible to reduce our nation's debt without harming social security and other vital programs.
